stories.text:
I was just reading about Norton installing a cryptominer by default, and after reading the comments on HN it seems that all AV products do is slow down the computer. In fact, they don't seem terribly good at detecting many viruses and malware.

My question is: do people recommend still using AV programs any more on Windows?
stories.title: Ask HN: Is antivirus on Windows worthwhile any more?
Venge.io â€“ free web based multiplayer FPS

stories.text:
My wife are seriously considering moving down to Miami from Boston. How's the overall scene? I mean startups, culture, people, etc.

Would love some insights from people who made a similar move.

How are the summers, really? Cost of life? Is Brickell a good place to start?
stories.title: How's the Miami Scene?
Intel Patch for Linux Will Allow Updating System Firmware Without Rebooting
